attributes.action: Do not remove GCSE Computer Science
attributes.additional_details:
GCSE Computer Science provides the bedrock of the content for A-Level Computer Science. Many schools already struggle to complete the entire content for A-Level CS with classes that have all done the subject for GCSE.

It seems that the government wants to replace GCSE CS with a more ICT focused qualification, which would remove that bedrock for the A-Level.

If the government would like to encourage ICT skills, they should introduce a new GCSE ICT to exist alongside GCSE Computer Science.
attributes.background:
The government has recently announced its plan to replace the “narrowly focused” GCSE Computer Science with a “broader, future facing” GCSE Computing.

We believe that the government should not do this and that it would harm student outcomes, as opposed to benefitting them.
